content.description: A national newspaper reported that <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of high school students engage in community service activities. A school administrator wondered whether the proportion of high school students at the administratorâ€™s school who engage in community service activities is less than <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent. The administrator selected a random sample of <math alttext="100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> students, and <math alttext="36" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> responded that they do engage in community service activities. The conditions for inference were met, and an appropriate hypothesis test resulted in a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of <math alttext="0.207" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.207</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which of the following is a correct interpretation of this <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value?

choices.label: The probability that a randomly selected student at this high school engages in community service activities is <math alttext="0.207" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.207</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The probability is <math alttext="0.40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> that less than <math alttext="20.7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20.7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of students at this high school engage in community service activities.

The probability is <math alttext="0.207" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.207</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> that less than <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of students at this high school engage in community service activities.

If the proportion of all students at the school who engage in community service activities is <math alttext="0.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the probability of observing <math alttext="36" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> or fewer in a random sample of <math alttext="100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> students who engage in community service activities is <math alttext="0.207" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.207</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

If the proportion of all students at the school who engage in community service activities is <math alttext="0.36" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the probability of obtaining <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> or fewer in a random sample of <math alttext="100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> who engage in community service activities is <math alttext="0.207" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.207</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: If the proportion of all students at the school who engage in community service activities is <math alttext="0.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the probability of observing <math alttext="36" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> or fewer in a random sample of <math alttext="100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> students who engage in community service activities is <math alttext="0.207" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.207</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
